Alternative variation: 24... Bxf1 [a horrible slip] 25. Qxh6 Re5 26. Bxe5 Qxf2  27. Kxf2 f6 28. Qg6  Kf8 29. Bd6#
The queen and the bishop are under attack... The queen must protect the bishop, because of the f7 square.

Black is ruining his position
Alternative variation: 25... Qd3 26. Rfd1 Qe2 $17 (26... Qxe4 $2 [is no good] 27. Rxc4 Re7 28. Rc5 $18)

but even a better move would not have saved the game
Alternative variation: 26... Qa2 27. Rf3 f5 ( 27... Rxe4 [the pawn contains a lethal dose of poison] 28. Rf6 Kg8 29. Rxh6 $18) 28. Rxf5 Rf8 (28... Rxe4 [taking that pawn is still a mistake] 29. Rf6 Qxf2  30. R1xf2 Re1  31. Kh2 Rh1  32. Kxh1 Re8 33. Qxh6  Kg8 34. Rg6#) 29. Rxg5 Rg8 $18

but even a better move would not have saved the game

Thanks to the black Queen, white had time to bring its rook to the mating attack!
If Black now only could play Ba2...
